summary: To be eligible for benefits, some Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) recipients must comply with work requirements, which may include participating in a state’s SNAP Employment and Training program. These programs are intended to help recipients become self-sufficient. We found that only a small number of SNAP recipients participated in these programs—less than 1% per month on average in 2016. However, USDA has limited data...
title: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program: More Complete and Accurate Information Needed on Employment and Training Programs
